speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good morning, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Good morning.  [_Roz starts to kiss Frasier passionately.  He struggles free after a while._]

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell was that?

speaker: Roz
text: [_looks around_] Oh, shoot!  He's not even here!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wiping off kiss_] Who?

speaker: Roz
text: Do you remember that guy who dumped me last month?  I thought he was right behind me.  I just wanted him to see me with another guy so he'd know how completely over him I am!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good idea, Roz.  If that doesn't work, why don't we get married and have some children, that will really fix his wagon!

speaker: Roz
text: You might remember him, Stan?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thinks_] Stan?  The smug stockbroker who kept calling me "Frazer?"

speaker: Roz
text: Oh yeah, that's the one.  One minute, we're hot an' heavy and then he stops calling.  It's so humiliating when someone treats you like you don't even exist.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not listening to her_] How can someone not hear the difference between "Frasier" and "Frazer"?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, that's what bugged me the most too! [_to waiter_] I'll have an espresso to go, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, Roz, I almost forgot, here's the invitation to my dad's birthday party.  Sherry's giving it, so please excuse the elegant verse, but...  [_Frasier hands it over._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_reads_] "Come one, Come all, To jump and jive, Marty Crane's turning sex-ty-five!"  [_She notices Stan enter the Caf e._]

speaker: Roz
text: Oh my God, here he is.  Please?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right.  [_Frasier and Roz start kissing passionately which turns Stan away. They keep on kissing, not noticing Niles enter the Cafe._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.  [_Startled, Frasier breaks away from Roz, who continues the charade by keeping her arms around him and nuzzling his neck._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  You know, this isn't what it looks like.  You see, her ex-boyfriend was just... [_off her nuzzling_] Oh, just stop that!

speaker: Niles
text: Please, no explanation necessary.  I assume that at the next meeting of Seattle's "Haven't Kissed Roz Club," it will just be me and the archbishop!

speaker: Roz
text: I'll save you the club fees.

speaker: Niles
text: What-?  [_Roz kisses Niles and exits, leaving him somewhat philosophical._]

speaker: Niles
text: Everyone kisses better than Maris!  [_Frasier and Niles move to a table._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to waiter_] Can I get one of the same for Dr. Crane, please? [sits with Niles]

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry I'm late, I was shopping for Dad's present.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it's all right, Niles.  I did a bit of that myself this morning.  I found a lovely little calfskin wallet with a matching key case.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Well, bravo, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and it was a full twenty dollars below our agreed-upon spending limit.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm so glad we agreed to rein ourselves in this year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God, me too.  Finally to do away with our annual contest to see who could give dad the most lavish gift.

speaker: Niles
text: I think the competition had gotten a bit... er, what is the best word for it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Extreme.

speaker: Niles
text: No, childish.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gaudy.

speaker: Niles
text: Crass.

speaker: Frasier
text: Obscene.

speaker: Niles
text: Baroque.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!  So, what did you get him?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, just some... beer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, we're not exactly bumping our heads on that spending ceiling, are we?

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughs_] It's a bit fancier than that.  It's a membership in a beer club.  They deliver a case from a different micro brewery every month.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I looked into those clubs, they're rather expensive.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not really.  I'm right at our limit.  Maybe with taxes and handling I'm a drop or two over.

speaker: Frasier
text: How big a drop?

speaker: Niles
text: Just, er... a hundred dollars over.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's not a drop, it's a downpour!

speaker: Niles
text: It's a dribble.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a deluge!

speaker: Niles
text: It's a...

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop it!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, why don't you just stick a hundred dollars in that wallet of yours and we'll call it even.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, frankly, I don't need to buy dad's love.  You've opted to violate our agreement, so be it.  I have a gift, you have a gift.

speaker: Niles
text: Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Big baby!  [_Frasier and Niles look away from each other._]  [_Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier is seated reading the newspaper as Eddie stares up at him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Stare all you like.  You will not distract me from my paper. You see, your efforts are futile, I can't even see you.  [_Frasier holds the paper up in front of him.  Eddie, however, just keeps jumping into view over the paper.  Frasier, in agitation, folds the paper up and exits with Eddie to the kitchen.  Daphne and Niles then enter carrying shopping bags._]

speaker: Niles
text: It seems so unhealthy.  Is she going to serve anything at Dad's party but meat?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sherry says that's what he and his old cronies like best. With drinks, she's serving cocktail franks.  For appetisers, we're having a sausage medley.  And for the main course there's a choice of meat loaf or meat balls.

speaker: Niles
text: I assume these colourful balloons are for the between course angioplasty!  [_Sherry enters and notices them as Frasier re-enters._]

speaker: Sherry
text: Did you get everything, Daphne?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes, I think so.

speaker: Sherry
text: Good news, I found a guy who can sculpt an exact replica of Marty's old police badge out of six pounds of liverwurst.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how reminiscent of the cream cheese gavel they gave Thurgood Marshall on his eightieth!  [_Martin enters holding a photo as Daphne exits to her room._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we can't use this photograph, it's too embarrassing.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_laughs_] That's exactly why we're using it.  I'm decorating the whole party with old pictures of Marty from the force.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, we can't use this one of me at the morgue; it's too disturbing.  [_Niles takes a look._]

speaker: Niles
text: You're right, I totally forgot you even had a perm!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, God, I can't wait to see this guy again.  Mickey Doogan. We rode mounted patrol together.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, look at you.  You look so big and handsome on your horse. [_looks at another_] Oh my God, when was this taken?

speaker: Martin
text: April Fools' Day.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks_] Oh, yes, yes, that would explain why your horses are wearing brassieres.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh God, I loved that horse.  Old Agides and I were together for eight years.  Best partner I ever had.

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, we should get going.

speaker: Martin
text: Okay.

speaker: Sherry
text: Marty, where ever did you find a bra that could fit a horse?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Mickey brought it in from home.  Mae Doogan was a lot of things, but petite she wasn't!  I'll point her out to you at the party.

speaker: Sherry
text: Honey, if that's her bra, I can spot her myself.  [_Martin and Sherry exit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, er, sherry, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Oooh... [_looks at watch_] ...no, thanks, I've got a session.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah. [_pours himself one_]  [_Daphne enters with a box and wrapping paper_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, is your father gone?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he has.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good, then I'll wrap his present.  They fit fine in this box.

speaker: Frasier
text: Great, Daphne, off you go.

speaker: Niles
text: Wait a minute.  That box is awfully big for what you got him.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, it isn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Your binoculars fit just perfectly in here!

speaker: Niles
text: You told me you got him a wallet and a key case!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, no, not this again!  It's the same nonsense every year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, not this year.  We'd actually agreed to a spending limit until someone else exceeded it.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  Guilty as charged.  We've each violated the pact once.  Now let's stop before this madness gets out of hand.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if you ask me, your gifts compliment each other perfectly.

speaker: Niles
text: Em, Daphne... [_puts a finger to his lips_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Your binoculars and your football tickets.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tickets?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_"Uh-oh..."_] Season tickets to the Seahawks.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't believe you!  You already had a better gift than mine, you still saw the need to take it to a higher level.

speaker: Niles
text: Only because I knew you were going to upgrade that wallet, which you did!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, enough is enough.  I quit, I'm throwing in the towel.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, and why should I believe you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Because this is a receipt for the binoculars, this should prove to you that I have no intention of returning them in order to get a better gift. [_tears it up_] There.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that's very big of you.  I'm late for my session.  If it's any consolation, I'm not really sure how good those tickets are.  I was hoping to get something on the first two yard lines but I could only get ones way back on the fiftieth!  [_Niles shrugs innocently and exits._]  [_N.B. Being on the fiftieth yard line means you are seated right next to the center of the field, at the bottom of the stands next to the green - the best seats in the stadium.  However, Niles is no doubt ignorant of this, so his innocence must be genuine._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm very proud of you, Dr. Crane.  I...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, stop babbling, Daphne, and bring me some tape!  [_Daphne rolls her eyes._]  **COME AGAIN WHEN YOU CAN'T STAY SO LONG**  [_Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Sherry and Daphne are sat running through Martin's upcoming party._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Okay, the keg of beer will be there by six.  I also confirmed the band, ordered the cake, filled out the place cards, picked up the humourous cocktail napkins and I'm almost done making the centerpieces.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_sighs_] Oh, this party is just going to wear me out!  [_Niles enters._]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne, Sherry. [_to waitress_] Double Latte, please. [_sits_] Is Frasier with you?

speaker: Sherry
text: No, he's out shopping for your dad.

speaker: Niles
text: That jackal!  [_Niles jumps to his feet and dashes out of the Caf e._]

speaker: Sherry
text: What was that all about?

speaker: Daphne
text: Brother snit.  Don't ask.

speaker: Sherry
text: I forgot to tell you.  I found this fabulous photograph of Marty arresting some guy.  I had it blown up to life size, then I cut out the crook's face so people could stick their heads through and have a snap shot of Marty reading them their rights.  Don't you just love it?

speaker: Daphne
text: It depends.  Do I have to pick it up?

speaker: Sherry
text: By five, you're a doll!  [_Frasier enters with a shopping bag and greets them._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, did you find something?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I did.  It took me most of the afternoon but I finally came up with something I think is just about perfect!  [_The waitress brings Niles's coffee as Frasier sits._]

speaker: Sherry
text: Oh, Niles forgot his coffee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles was here?

speaker: Sherry
text: Yes, but you know, when I mentioned that you were out shopping for your dad he just shot out of here like a bullet!

speaker: Frasier
text: That little worm!  [_Frasier grabs his shopping bag and exits._]  [_Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Daphne is seated on the couch reading, her feet on the table. Frasier enters as she quickly lowers them.  His jacket is slung over his shoulder and he looks exhausted._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, are you all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I am not.  I've combed the entire city trying to find a gift - but nothing is better than what Niles got him.

speaker: Daphne
text: What did your brother get him?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  I'm sure it's something any father would just love.  [_Martin enters from his room._]

speaker: Martin
text: Why, you know the best thing about turning sixty-five? Everybody wants to buy you dinner! [_laughs_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Mr. Crane, you've left your top button unbuttoned.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, that's because Duke's taking me to Hoppy's Old Heidelberg.  You know, if I don't unbutton it now, it might fly off and hurt somebody!

speaker: Frasier
text: Enjoy, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, I will.  I gotta tell 'ya, I'm loving this birthday.  All of a sudden my money's no good.  Last night, Ed Flannagan bought the whole bar a round in my honour.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's Ed Flannagan?

speaker: Martin
text: That's what I asked!  Anyway, what are you doing tonight, Fras'?

speaker: Frasier
text: Er, nothing much.  I've got some shopping to do.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, for anybody we know? [_laughs_] You know, Fras', every year, you and Niles, you go overboard trying to find these great presents for me and I've got to be honest, it's always made me kind of uncomfortable.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_relieved_] Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah.  So this year, I just wanted you to know... I'm over it!  So, go crazy, you only turn sixty-five once!  [_Martin exits.  Frasier stands up, puts his head in his arms and collapses onto his father's chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, Dr. Crane,  the last thing I want to do is encourage more competition between you and your brother. [_goes to him_] But if you really want to make your father happy, maybe the time has come...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't even say it!

speaker: Daphne
text: But it's the only thing he's ever asked for!

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  God, it'll ruin my apartment, my life!  I can't, I won't, I mustn't!

speaker: Daphne
text: It's over, Dr. Crane.  [_Frasier cries into her arms._]  [_Scene Five - Frasier's Apartment. We see the back of a huge monstrosity of some kind.  The camera raises to its peak (which is basically at the roof of the apartment) and shows Frasier and Daphne sitting on Martin's chair, looking up, awestruck, at the mother of all-_]

speaker: Daphne
text: That is one big-screen TV.  He's going to love it!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in tears_] I know!  [_Daphne nurses Frasier._]  [_End of Act One_]  [_Act Two_]  [_Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. We resume the scene. Daphne is cleaning the big-screen television as Frasier looks on._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Perhaps I'm panicking needlessly.  It just needs a little dressing-up, really.  You know, I'll just arrange these plants here at the base. [_he does_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, you always said you needed more greenery in here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, maybe an _objet_ or two on top.  Yes, yes, this little bud vase, here.  [_Frasier puts a rose vase on the top and admires it, giving a little Bette Davis shrug._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_denial_] That makes a world of difference, doesn't it?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_acting_] Oh, sure it does, Dr. Crane.  All the difference in the world!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_falling to bits_] Oh, it's ghastly! [_doorbell sounds_] Oh God, you just don't put a smear of lipstick on the Bride of Frankenstein and turn her into a trophy wife, do you?!  [_Frasier opens the door to Niles._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, are you ready? We told dad we'd pick him up at...  [_Niles notices the eyesore.  He is speechless as Frasier watches him in some sort of jealous pride._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh my God, you didn't?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Didn't what?  You mean buy dad this television set?  Of course I did!  Ah, it's impressive, isn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: I knew how jealous you were, but to go to such insane lengths to top me... Frasier, you have lain waste to your apartment with this eyesore!

speaker: Frasier
text: I disagree!  Where you see an eyesore, I see a picture window to a world of art and culture.  Just think how a screen this size will enhance the majesty of the Metropolitan Opera.  Or the thrilling artists of the Bolshoi!

speaker: Niles
text: You're quite a Bolshoi artist yourself!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're right, it's dreadful, isn't it!  But you know, it's worth it, just to imagine the smile it'll put on dad's face, not to mention the pleasure of watching you twist and writhe in envy. [_pause_] You're not twisting and writhing!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, my mind wandered.  I was remembering Dad waxing nostalgic the other day about his beloved old horse, Agides.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't try to change the subject, Niles, you've lost, admit it!

speaker: Niles
text: He certainly did love that horse.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can only live in denial for so long before you...  [_Frasier gasps in sudden realisation._]

speaker: Frasier
text: You didn't?!

speaker: Niles
text: Didn't what?  Buy the horse?  Sorry, did!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh! ... Oh... how could you?!

speaker: Niles
text: I've already set him up in a handsome stable.  Dad can visit him anytime he wants, which reminds me, I'd like to swing by the stable on the way to the party so dad can- [_laughs_] look his gift horse in the mouth!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, all right, Niles.  What else can I do?  I give up!  You win.  You have found the one gift that can't be trumped.  [_The doorbell sounds as Daphne goes to get it._]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Frasier.  You're a gracious loser.

speaker: Frasier
text: Still, on the bright side, I know dad will love this set. He really will.  And already it doesn't seem quite as intrusive as it did when it first got here.  [_Daphne opens the door to some workers wielding enormous dynamo speakers._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Right this way.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in horror_] What are those?

speaker: Daphne
text: Your speakers.  [_Frasier buries his head.  Niles comforts him._]  **SURE, BUT CAN HE DO LONG DIVISION?**  [_Scene Two - Horse Stables. Frasier and Niles lead a blindfolded Martin into the stables._]

speaker: Niles
text: So, dad, any idea where you are?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's so mysterious.  Hay under foot, stable smells, that saddle we just tripped over... I mean, we could be anywhere!

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right.  [_Niles takes his blindfold off._]

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: _Voila!_ [_motioning to horse_] Happy birthday.  [_Martin is shown to a horse in a pen.  "AGIDES" entitles it.  Martin and Niles react as Frasier stays at the back of the stable in jealous anger._]

speaker: Martin
text: Agides!  Hey, buddy, how are you doing?  Oh, long-time-no-see. [_to Niles_] What's going on?

speaker: Niles
text: He's yours, dad.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: I bought him for you.

speaker: Martin
text: You're kidding me, I can't believe it!

speaker: Niles
text: You can visit him anytime you want.

speaker: Martin
text: This is amazing. [_to Agides_] How've you been, buddy, huh? Hey, one plus one equals?  [_Agides kicks the stable door twice._]

speaker: Martin
text: He remembers!

speaker: Niles
text: I figured it was a long shot when I called but they were a week away from putting him out to pasture, so I set him up here at Brier Wood, it's the most exclusive stable in town. Don't be surprised if you spy a certain resident trotting by wearing his triple crown.

speaker: Frasier
text: They don't give them actual crowns, you twit! [_pause_] Well, come on, Dad, you don't want to be late for the party, I'm sure Sherry's getting warm in that cake!  [_Martin seems entranced by the horse._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't want to be late.

speaker: Niles
text: Are you all right, dad?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I'm fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, I said I was fine.  Now, come on, let's go to my party.  [_They start to exit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there something you'd like to talk about?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, now, come on, guys.  You don't have to pull everything apart.  I said I'm fine, all right?  Let's go.  [_Martin exits._]

speaker: Niles
text: All that effort, all that expense... How many minutes of joy did it buy?  [_Frasier raises his foot, horse-style, and stamps the ground once, twice, three times.  They exit._]  [_Scene Three - Frasier's Apartment. The lights are off as the brothers enter later that night.  As they switch on the lights, the television and speakers are revealed.  The speakers are arranged, circumferencing Martin's chair._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear God!  It's Stonehenge!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I hope it'll at least cheer dad up.  The party certainly didn't.

speaker: Frasier
text: God, I know.  Not even when Sherry sang that little ditty she'd composed; "You Can Cop A Feel If I Can Feel A Cop"! Brandy, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Please.  [_Frasier pours._]

speaker: Niles
text: I tried to draw Dad out of the party, he just shot me right down.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know how he is.  Gets himself into these moods, he just retreats.

speaker: Niles
text: It's just so damn frustrating.  How many wonders if that isn't why we go so insane every year, trying to find the perfect gift, as if somehow finding the right present will magically change everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: The thought occurred to me too.

speaker: Niles
text: You didn't mention it.

speaker: Frasier
text: It occurred to me.

speaker: Niles
text: So you say.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it... stop it!  [_Sherry enters._]

speaker: Sherry
text: Hiya, boys. [_notices television and gasps_] Wow!  She's a beaut!  Oh, Marty and I are going to be spending a lot more time over here! [_hangs up coat_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Niles_] It's the gift that keeps on giving!

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, where's your dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: He said he was coming home with you.

speaker: Sherry
text: Well, he told me that he was coming home with you.

speaker: Niles
text: Why would he do that?

speaker: Sherry
text: He was a little down at the party.  Maybe he just wanted to go for a walk.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sure he's all right.  He'll be back soon.

speaker: Niles
text: Still, it is rather late.  I'll just go and look for him. [_heads to door_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, suit yourself, Niles.  I think you're fretting needlessly.

speaker: Sherry
text: [_takes remote_] Come on, let's fire this baby up.  Do you like the Nashville Network?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, who am I kidding?!  I'm worried sick!  [_Frasier and Niles exit as Sherry sits down with the remote._]  [_Scene Four - Horse Stables. Martin is feeding Agides as the boys enter quietly._]

speaker: Martin
text: Here you go.  Hey, no offense, but your teeth look like hell! I gotta tell you, the rest of you's not looking that much better either.  Do you want me to give you a little rubdown, huh? [_he uses the brush_] Ah, that takes me back.  Of course, your coat was a lot shinier in those days.  Hell, so was mine. [_laughs_] We were something, weren't we Agides, huh?  Riding crowd control.  People'd just step aside to let us pass.  Now, they're putting you out to pasture and I'm riding the buses. It's fun getting old, isn't it?!  Hey, this is a nice place here, you know.  I bet you're really going to like it here.  [_A horse near the entrance begins to lick Niles's face.  He makes some noise whilst trying to stop him, however Frasier quiets him._]

speaker: Martin
text: And you know, if you don't like it here, then we'll do what we said we would.  We'll just go to Montana, start a ranch. [_the boys are shocked_] You know, we still got all that money we took from those drug dealers buried in the old box canyon.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_realises_] All right, dad, we know you know we're here.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, why don't you get the hell out of here?

speaker: Niles
text: Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I just want to be alone with him, is that all right with you?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, fine, we'll see you later. [_starts to exit, then_] You know, it is a little troubling that you feel more comfortable talking to your horse than you do to your sons.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, we might be able to help you with what you're going through; the ageing process...

speaker: Martin
text: Now, come on, now, stop it.  You see, this is the problem. I know everything you're going to say.  First of all, you'll start talking about sixty-five as being some sort of passage.  And then you'll start spouting these theories and quoting Freud and who knows what else until by the time you get through analysing me, I'm going to be sixty-six!  Look, when I tell Agides something, you know what he does? Nothing.  He just listens to me.

speaker: Niles
text: We listen.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's my slogan; "I'm Listening."  You know, dad, listening is the foundation...  [_Niles and Frasier start rabbiting on about the usefulness of listening without putting their theory into practice.  Martin glances at them._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Niles
text: Shush.

speaker: Frasier
text: Shush!

speaker: Martin
text: When I saw Agides today, it was kinda of a shock to see how old he's gotten and I just... It made me realise how old I've gotten.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you still have a lot of...

speaker: Martin
text: Now, come on...

speaker: Frasier
text: Sorry, sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, it's not a problem you can solve, Frasier.  It's just a fact of life.  People get old.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess this horse wasn't quite the banner gift I thought it would be.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yes, it was, Niles.  I'm feeling a little bit sorry for myself right now, but I'll get over that.  But I love this horse, it's the greatest present I've ever gotten.  [_Niles notices Frasier beginning to writhe in envy again._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm glad, dad, but, you know, I think I may have misled you.  The horse is from me _and_ from Frasier.  [_Frasier is moved by this._]

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Jeez, I'm sorry.  Thanks a lot, Fras'.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually, it was mostly Niles's idea.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, then, thanks to both of you.  [_The three Crane man are happy._]

speaker: Martin
text: It's just great.  Well, come on, we ought to get going. Let's get a move on. [_to Agides_] See ya, buddy. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what a generous gesture.  How can I ever thank you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well... [_takes out his mobile_] by calling your super and getting rid of that monstrosity in your apartment! I do visit from time to time, you know.  [_Niles dials a number on his mobile and hands it to Frasier._]  [_End of Act Two_]
